div0.head: *g
div0.entryFree:
g, third letter in Gr. alphabet; as Numeral g/ =
three, third, thrice: also, with pr. n., *ba/ssos g/
B., son and grandson of B.,
IGRom. 4.1587
(ii A. D.), etc.: but g'
=
3 , 000
written for v, freq. in Hsch. , as ganda/nein: a)re/skein, etc.
ga^, Dor. for ge, Ar. Ach. 775 , etc.; cf. e^gwga , tu/ga.
ga=, Dor. and Aeol. for gh=.
gabaqo/n: tru/blion, Hsch. ; cf. za/batos.

gabala/n: e)gke/falon h)\ kefalh/, Id. ga/bena: o)cuba/fia h)/toi tru/blia, Id. gabergo/r (= ga_vergo/s),
labourer ( Lacon. ), Id.

*ga^ga/ths (sc. li/qos), ou, o(,
lignite, Orph. L. 474 , Plin. HN 36.141 , Dsc. 5.128 , Gal. 12.203 , Gp. 15.1.32 .
jet, Solin. 22.11 .
= a)stra/galos , cj. in Ps.- Dsc. 4.61 . (From *ga/gas or *ga/ggai, a town and river in Lycia.)
gaggai/nein: to\ meta\ ge/lwtos prospai/zein, Hsch.

gagga^l-ia/w,
= -i/zesqai , Hsch.

gagga^l-i/zw, later form of Att.
gargali/zw, Phryn. 77 , Anacreont. 5.7 (but the contrary is stated in Phryn. PS p.56
B. ).
gagga^l-i/des: gelasi=noi, Hsch.

ga/gga^l-os, o(,
fickle person, Id.

gagga^m-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
fisher, Hsch.
gagga^m-euth/s, ou=, o(, = foreg., prob. in EM 219.25 .

ga/gga^m-on, to/,
small round net, esp. for oystercatching, Opp. H. 3.81 : metaph., me/ga doulei/as g. A. Ag. 361 (anap.): —also gagga/mh, h(, Str. 7.3.18 .
umbilical region, Poll. 2.169 (gaggamw/n is f.l.).

gagga^m-oulko/s, o/n, (e(/lkw)
dragging an oyster-net,
EM <*> 19.23 .

*gagghtiko/s, h/, o/n,
from the Ganges, na/rdos, a fragrant medicinal grass, =
Cymbopogon Iwarancusa,
Peripl.M.Rubr. 63 ; sindo/nes ibid.
gaggali/as (leg. gaggali/das): oi( me\n gelasi=non, oi( de\ th\n tw=n neu/rwn (e)ri/wn cod.) sustrofh/n, a)/lloi u(posta/qmhn, Hsch.

*gaggi=tis or *gaggh=tis li/qos,
= *gaga/ths , Str. 16.1.24 : also *g. na/rdos,
= *gagghtikh\ na/rdos , Dsc. 1.7 , Damocr. ap. Gal. 13.1057 .

gaggli/on, to/,
encysted tumour on a tendon or
aponeurosis, Philagr. ap. Aët. 15.9 ( *)aqhna=
21.29
), Heras ap. Gal. 13.815 , etc.; also on the head, Paul.Aeg. 6.39 ; the nerve-knots now called
ganglia are compared to such a tumour, Gal. UP 16.5 .

gaggliw/dhs, es,
of the ganglion kind, Hp. Art. 40 :—also gagglioeidh/s, e/s, Hsch.

ga/ggrain-a, h(, (gra/w ?)
gangrene, Hp. Mochl. 33 , 2 Ep.Ti. 2.17 , Dsc. 1.61 , Plu. 2.65d , Gal. 18(1).687 .

gaggrain-iko/s, h/, o/n,
gangrenous, nomai/
Dsc. 2.107
: -ka/, ta/ , Id. 4.93 . Adv.
-kw=s
Heliod.
(?)ap. Orib. 47.16.1 .

gaggrain-o/omai, Pass. ,
become gangrenous, Hp. Art. 63 , Gal. 18 ( 1 ). 156 .

gaggrain-w/dhs, es,
of the gangrene kind, Hp. Epid. 7.110 , Gal. 11.818 .
gaggrai/n-wma, to/, = sq., Pall. Febr. 7 .

gaggrai/n-wsis, ews, h(,
becoming gangrenous: gangrenous affection, flebw=n
Hp. Fract. 11
(pl.), Mochl. 30 (pl.), Aret. SA 2.10 (pl.).
*ga/da^ra [*ga^], wn, ta/ , a town in Palestine, Str. 16.2.29 :—*ga^da^reu/s or *ga^da^rhno/s, o(, an inhabitant, Ev.Matt. 8.28 :—*ga^da^ri/s (sc. gh=), h(, the country, Str.l.c.

ga/daros,
= gai+da/rion , Diogenian. 5.36 .

gadei=n, ga/desqai,
= vad- (vhd-), Hsch. :—also gadeda=n: xai/rein, and gadew/: xara/, Id.

*ga/deira [*ga^], wn, ta/ , Cadiz, Pi. N. 4.69 , etc.; Ion.
*gh/deira
Hdt. 4.8 : *ga^deiri/ths [i_], *ga^deireu/s, o(,
a man of Cadiz, St.Byz. :—Adj. *ga^deiriko/s, h/, o/n
, ta/rixos
Eup. 186
, Pl. Criti. 114b ; or *ga^deirai=os, a, on, as *g. porqmo/s the Straits
of Gibraltar, Plu. Sert. 8 . Adv. *ga^deiro/qen
AP 14.121 ( Metrod. ), Euthyd. ap. Ath. 3.116c .

*ga^deita/na, h(,
woman of Cadiz, courtesan,
PGrenf. 1.53.28 (iv A. D.: gaeit- Pap.).
gadh/: ki/bwtos, Hsch.
ga/dic<is>: o(mologi/a, Hsch. (va/d-). ga=dos: ga/la, a)/lloi o)/cos, Id.

ga/dos, a
fish, = o)/nos , Dorio ap. Ath. 7.315f .
= ga/ndos (q.v.).

gaew/n, w=nos, o(,
v. gaiw/n .

ga/za [ga_], h( ,
treasure, Thphr. HP 8.11.5 , OGI 54.22
(iii B. C.), Epigr. ap. Str. 14.1.39 , LXX 2 Es. 5.17 , Act.Ap. 8.27 , etc.; e)k th=s basilikh=s g. D.S. 17.35 .
large sum of money, Plb. 11.34.12 . (Persian word.)

ga/zas, a
fish, Hsch.

*gazi/tion, to/,
Gaza measure,
POxy. 1924.8
(v/vi A. D.).

ga_zo-fu^la^ke/w,
to be a treasurer, D.S. 17.74 .

ga_zo-fu^la/kion [la^], to/ ,
treasury, OGI 225.16 (Didyma, iii B. C.), LXX 4 Ki. 23.11 , Str. 7.6.1 , Ev.Luc. 21.1 , al.

ga_zo-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o( ,
treasurer, Phylarch. 29 , LXX 1 Ch. 28.1 , Str. 16.2.40 , J. AJ 11.1.3 , Plu. Demetr. 25 ; written gazzo-, Syria 5.347 (Dura).
ga/qeudon: e)k gh=s r(e/on, Hsch.
ga_qe/w, ga/qw, Dor. for ghqe/w, gh/qw. gaqi/a: a)llanti/a, Hsch.

gai=a, h(, gen.
gai/hs
Hom.
(and Antiph. , v. infr.), Trag. gai/as, dat. gai/a|
A. Pers. 618
, S. Aj. 659 , E. Med. 736 , etc., acc. gai=an: nom. gai/h only in late Poets, IG 14.1935 , etc.; Dor.
gai/a_ ib. 803 (Naples): pl. gai=ai
Od.
(v. infr.), LXX 4 Ki. 18.35 , al.:—poet. for gh=,
land, country, fi/lhn e)s patri/da gai=an to one's dear father
land, Il. 2.140 , al.; gai=a/n te teh\n dh=mo/n te
Od. 8.555
: pl., ou)de/ tis a)/llh fai/neto gaia/wn
12.404
, D.P. 882 .
earth, xuth\ g.
earth thrown up to form a cairn, Il. 23.256 ; w)= g. kerami/, of potters'
earth, Eub. 43 , cf. Sannyr. 4 ; ku/tos plasto\n e)k gai/hs
Antiph. 52.3
; the forms gaiw=n, gai/ais, gai/as in codd. of LXX are written for gew=n, etc.
earth, as an element, u(mei=s . . u(/dwr kai\ g. ge/noisqe
Il. 7.99
; e)mou= qano/ntos g. meixqh/tw puri/
Trag.Adesp. 513
; gai/hs kai\ u(/datos e)kgeno/mesqa
Xenoph. 33
, cf. Emp. 17.18 , 109.1 , etc.
the earth, Theoc. 18.20 : elsewh. *gai=a, as pr. n., Earth, Hes. Th. 45 , A. Eu. 2 , etc. (The usu. form in Hom. ; used in Trag. metri gr. and by Com. in paratrag., v. supr.)

gaia/das: o( dh=mos ( Lacon. ), Hsch.
gaia=tai: kertomei=, Id. (leg. glia=tai).

gai+da/rion, to/,
donkey,
PAmh. 2.153
(vi/vii A. D.). (Arabic word.)
gaih-genh/s, e/s, poet. for ghgenh/s, A.R. 3.1186 .

gai/h-qen, Adv.
from the land, Opp. H. 1.39 .
out of the earth, e)kfu/etai g. Orac. ap. Eus. PE 6.2 ( App.Anth. 6.113 );
from the earth, a)nasth/santes Orac. ib. 5.9 ( App.Anth. 6.162 ).

gaih/-i+os, a, on,
sprung from Gaia or Earth, *tituo/n, *gaih/i+on ui(o/n
Od. 7.324
, cf. AP 14.23 .
earthly, bi/ou brote/ou g. desma/
Nonn. D. 37.4
; mele/wn g. a)/xqos
Eranos 13.88
.

gaih/-oxos (also gaih-ou=xos, Hsch. ), Dor.
gaia/oxos, on, gaia/voxos
IG 5(1).213 (Sparta, v B. C.):—epith. of Poseidon,
earth-moving, earth-carrying, Il. 13.43 , al., A. Th. 310 (lyr.), cf. S. OC 1072 (lyr.): *gaia/oxos, abs., Il. 13.125 , Pi. O. 13.81 , and so *gaia/voxos (v. supr.): also in pl., *gaa/oxoi, name of a contest, IG 5(1).296.11 (Sparta).
w)keano\s g.
App.Anth. 3.209
.
protecting the country, gaia/oxe pagkrate\s *zeu=
A. Supp. 816
(lyr.); gaia/oxo/n t' *)/artemin
S. OT 160
(lyr.).
= h)peirw/ths , Hsch. (In signf. 1 from gai=a and vex-: vox-, cf. o)/xea, Lat.
veho, Skt.
váhati, Germ.
be-wegen, etc. In signf. 11 from e)/xw (q. v.).)

gaih-fa/gos [a^], on ,
earth-eating, of worms, Numen. ap. Ath. 7.305a ; cf. gafa/gas.
gaiqula (d supra scr.): a)mpelo/prasa, Hsch. ; cf. ghqulli/s.

gai+ko/s, h/, o/n,
concerning land, kri/ma
SIG 421.44
(Thermon, iii B. C.).
gai/netai: a)nu/ei, Hsch.

ga/i+nos, Dor.
= gh/i+nos (q. v.).

gaio-gra/fos [a^], o(,
= gewgra/fos , Hsch.

gaio-do/ths,
f.l. for gewdai/ths in Call. Fr. 158 .

gaio-me/trhs, ou, o(,
= gewm- , Man. 4.210 .

gaio-no/mos, on,
dwelling in the land: inhabitant, A. Supp. 54 (anap.).

ga/i+os[a_], a, on , Dor. for gh/i+os,
onland, A. Supp. 826 (lyr.);
earthy, g. ko/nis
Id. Th. 736
;
of the land, ko/gxoi
Epich. 42.9
; pai=s g. child
of earth, terrae filius, of a slave, prob. in IG 14.1432 (cf. ga/i+os para\ *)italiw/tais kai\ *taranti/nois o( mi/sqios
Eust. 188.30
, cf. EM 223.24 ); a)/nemos a
land wind, Hsch. ; also, = e)rga/ths bou=s , Id., EMl.c.
to\n ga/i+on,
= kataxqo/nion , prob. in A. Supp. 156 (lyr.).
gaio/s: makroke/nths h)\ ko/ntos h)\ kolobo/s, Cyr. , cf. Hsch.

gaio-fa/gos [a^], on,
= gaihfa/gos , Nic. Th. 784 .

gaio-fa^nh/s, e/s,
earth-coloured, in Comp. , Archig. ap. Orib. 8.2.4 ( v.l. gew- ); to\ g.
the earthy appearance of the moon, Placit. 2.30.1 codd.

gaio/w,
make land, make solid, Tz. H. 1.907 , al.

gai=sos, o( (or gai=son, to/, Ph. Bel. 99.16 , cf. AB 88 ), a sort of
javelin, LXX Jo. 8.18 , Ju. 9.7 , Plb. 6.39.3 , 18.18.4 , PTeb. 230
(ii B. C.), D.S. 13.57 :—hence prob. Celtic pr. n. *gaisa/tai or gai/o-oi, oi(, expld. by Plb. as
mercenaries, 2.22.1 . (Iberian word acc. to Ath. 6.273f .)
gai+=tai: gewrgoi/, Hsch., EM 223.29 .

gai+tana/, ta/,
aseptic ligaments made in Gaul, Gal. 10.942 , Marcell. Empir. 8.27 .

gai/w, impf.
gai/eskon
Hsch.
:—
rejoice, exult, Hom. only in Il. , in phrase, ku/dei+ gai/wn
Il. 1.405
, 5.906 , 8.51 ; [ *sfai=ros] moni/h| gai/wn
Emp. 27.4
. (ga/v-yw, v. ga/numai .)

gaiw/dhs,
f.l. for gew/dhs in Plb. 2.15.8 .

gaiw/n, w=nos, o(,
heap of earth, boundary-heap,
Tab.Heracl. 1.136 : gaew/n
IG 14.352i
i 83 (Halaesa, pl.).

ga/ka: h(de/ws, gakei=ai: glukei=ai, ga/kou: h(du/, gluku/, gakou/dia: h(du/smata, and gakoupw/nhs: h(dupo/ths, Hsch.
ga_ki/nas [i_], o( ,
earthquake, Id., Eust. 890.38 :—also ga_ki_ni/as, o(, Hsch. , and ga/ki_nos, o(, Att. acc. to EM 219.41 . gakto/s: kla/sma, Hsch. (vak-, cf. va/g-numi).

ga/la [^^], to/, gen. ga/laktos (also ga/lakos, dat.
ga/laki
Call. Hec. 1.4.4
, prob. in Pherecr. 108.18 , cf. An.Ox. 4.338 ), also tou= ga/la indecl., Pl.Com. 238 : dat. pl. ga/laci
Pl. Lg. 887d
. (For glakt-, cf. Lat.
lac for
glact):—milk, a)melgo/menoi g. leuko/n
Il. 4.434
, cf. Od. 4.88 , etc.; eu)/poton g., eu)trafe\s g., A. Pers. 611 , Ch. 898 ; e)n ga/lakti w)/n, teqramme/nh, at
the breast, E. HF 1266 , Pl. Ti. 81c ; e)n ga/laci tre/fesqai Id.Lg.l.c. (so metaph., e)n sparga/nois kai\ ga/lacin ei)=nai, of art, Ael. VH 8.8 ); dido/nai ga/la
X. Cyn. 7.4
; e)mplh=sai ga/laktos to fill full of
milk, Theoc. 24.3 : metaph., oi=)nos, *)afrodi/ths g.
Ar. Fr. 596
.
o)rni/qwn g. (o)/rniqos ga/la,
= o)rniqo/galon , Nic. Fr. 71.5 , Dsc. 2.144 ), prov. of rare and dainty things, Ar. V. 508 , Av. 734 , Mcn. 936 ; to\ lego/menon, spaniw/taton pa/restin o)rni/qwn g.
Mnesim. 9
, cf. Ach. Tat. Intr.Arat. 4 (expld. by Anaxag. 22 as
white of egg, cf. Sch. Luc. Merc.Cond. 13 ).
a)gaqo\n g. a good
wet-nurse, Call. Epigr. 51 ; ou)d' ei) g. lagou=
ei)=xon . . kai\ taw(=s, kath/sqion
Alex. 123
.
milky sap of plants, Thphr. HP 6.3.4 , etc.
the milky way, Parm. 11 , Arist. Mete. 345a12 , Arat. 476 ; but o( tou= ga/laktos ku/klos
Euc. Phaen. p.4M.
, Gem. 5.69 .

ga/lagga,
galingale, Alpinia officinarum, Aët. 1.131 .

ga^la^qhno/s, h/, o/n,
sucking, young, tender, nebroi/
Od. 4.336
, cf. Anacr. 51 ; te/kos
Simon. 52
; a)/rnes
Theoc. 18.41
, J. AJ 6.2.2 ; galaqhna/ (sc. pro/bata) Hdt. 1.183 ; (sc. xoiri/a) opp. te/leia, Pherecr. 44 , cf. Hp. Aff. 43 , SIG 1015.32 (Halic., written galaqeino/s) ; a)rnw=n kai\ xoi/rwn
Crates Com. 1
; u(=s
Pherecr. 28
, cf. Arist. HA 603b25 ; bre/fh
Clearch. 17
, cf. Theoc. 24.31 . (ga/la, qh=sqai.)

galai/rion, to/, and gala/tion, to/,
= ga/lion , Dsc. 4.95 .

galakoqre/mmwn, on, gen. onos, (tre/fw)
milk-fed, prob. in Antiph. 52.4 for galakto-. galako/xrws, = galakto/xrws , nom.pl. -xroes
Opp. C. 3.478
.

galakthfo/ros, on,
= galakto- , BCH 37.97
(ii/iii A. D.).

ga^lakt-i/as, ou, o(, with and without ku/klos,
= galaci/as , Ptol. Alm. 8.2 .

ga^lakt-ia/w,
give no milk, Poll. 3.50 ; but galaktiw=ntes: ga/laktos mestoi/, Hsch.

ga^lakt-i/zw,
to be milky in appearance, Dsc. 2.144 , 175 .
form a milky way, Phlp. in Mete. 117.20 .

ga^la/kt-inos, h, on,
milk-white, sth/qea
AP 5.192
( Diosc. ); xitw/n
POxy. 267.7
(i A. D.);
milky, xrw/mata
PHolm. 24.31
; v.l. for galakti/zon , Dsc. 2.175 .

ga^la/kt-ion, to/, Dim. of
ga/la, M.Ant. 5.4 : in pl.,
fancy bread made with milk, Alciphr. Fr. 6.10 .

ga/r (ge, a)/ra), causal Conj., used alone or with other Particles. introducing the reason or cause of what precedes,
for, tw=| ga\r e)pi\ fresi\ qh=ke qea\ leukw/lenos *(/hrh: kh/deto g. *danaw=n
Il. 1.56
, etc.; but freq. in expl. of that wh. is implied in the preceding clause, polla/wn poli/wn kate/luse ka/rhna . . tou= ga\r kra/tos e)sti\ me/giston
2.118
, etc.: hence, in simple explanations, esp. after a Pronoun or demonstr. Adj., a)lla\ to/d' ai)no\n a)/xos kradi/hn kai\ qumo\n i(ka/nei: *(/ektwr g. pote fh/sei
8.148
, cf. Od. 2.163 ; o(\ de\ deino/taton . . o( *zeu\s g. . . Ar. Av. 514 ; o(\ de\ pa/ntwn a)dikw/taton e)/doce: tw=n ga\r proge gramme/nwn h)ti/mwse kai\ ui(ou/s
Plu. Sull. 31
; freq. in introducing proofs or examples, martu/rion de/: *dh/lou g. kaqairome/nhs . . Th. 1.8 ; tekmh/rion de/: ou)/te g. *lakedaimo/nioi . . Id. 2.39 , cf. D. 20.10 , etc.; in full, tekmh/rion de\ tou/tou to/de: ai( me\n g. . . Hdt. 2.58 ; para/deigma to/de tou= lo/gou: e)k g. . . Th. 1.2 ; dhloi= de/ moi to/de: pro\ g. . . ib. 3 . to introduce a detailed description or narration already alluded to, o(/mws de\ lekte/a a(\ gignw/skw: e)/xei g. [h( xw/ra] pedi/a ka/llista . . X. An. 5.6.6 , etc. in answers to questions or statements challenging assent or denial,
yes, . . , no, . . , ou)/koun . . a)na/gkh e)sti/;—a)na/gkh g. ou)=n, e)/fh,
ay doubtless it is necessary, X. Cyr. 2.1.7 , cf. § 4 and 13 ; indicating assent, e)/xei g.
Pl. Phdr. 268a
; i(kano\s g., e)/fh, sumbai/nei g., e)/fh, Id. R. 502b , 502c ,cf. Ap. 41a , etc.; ou)/koun dh\ to/ g' ei)ko/s.—ou) g.: Id. Phdr. 276c . by inversion, preceding the fact explained,
since, as, *)atrei/+dh, polloi\ g. teqna=sin *)axaioi/ . . tw=| se xrh\ po/lemon pau=sai
Il. 7.328
; xro/nou de\ ou) pollou= dielqo/ntos (xrh=n g. *kandau/lh| gene/sqai kakw=s) e)/lege pro\s to\n *gu/ghn toia/de, *gu/gh, ou) g. se doke/w pei/qesqai . . (w)=ta g. tugxa/nei ktl.), poi/ei o(/kws . . Hdt. 1.8 . cf. 6.102 , al.; ei)=en, su\ g. tou/twn e)pisth/mwn, ti/ xrh\ poiei=n; Pl. Phd. 117a ; the principal proposition is sts. blended with the causal one, th=| de\ kakw=s g. e)/dee gene/sqai ei)=pe, i.e. h( de/ (kakw=s g. oi( e)/dee gene/sqai) ei)=pe
Hdt. 9.109
, cf. 1.24 , 4.149 , 200 , Th. 1.72 , 8.30 . attached to the hypothet. Particle instead of being joined to the apodosis, ou)d' ei) g. h)=n to\ pra=gma mh\ qeh/laton, a)ka/qarton u(ma=s ei)ko\s h)=n ou(/tws e)a=n, i.e. ou)de\ g. ei) h)=n . . , S. OT 255 . repeated, ou) g. ou)=n sigh/somai: e)/tikte g. . . Id. OC 980 , cf. Ant. 659 sq., 1255 . in elliptical phrases, where that of which ga/r gives the reason is omitted, and must be supplied, freq. in Trag. dialogue and Pl. , when
yes or
no may be supplied from the context, kai\ dh=t' e)to/lmas tou/sd' u(perbai/nein no/mous;—ou) g. ti/ moi *zeu\s h)=n o( khru/cas ta/de [yes],
for it was not Zeus, etc., S. Ant. 450 , cf. OT 102 , etc.; kalw=s ga\r au)to\s h)ga/nisai
Pl. Smp. 194a
; freq. in phrase e)/sti g. ou(/tw [yes],
for so it is, i. e. yes certainly: le/getai/ ti kaino/n; ge/noito g. a)/n ti kaino/teron h)\ . . ; [why,] could there be . . ? D. 4.10 ; with negs., Ar. Ra. 262
tou/tw| g. ou) nikh/sete [do so],
yet shall ye never prevail by this means: for a)lla\ g., v. infr. 11.1 . to confirm or strengthen something said, oi(/d' ou)ke/t' ei)si/: tou=to ga/r se dh/cetai [I say this],
for it will sting thee, E. Med. 1370 : after an Exclamation, w)= po/poi: a)na/riqma g. fe/rw ph/mata
S. OT 168

S. Aj. 764 ; xh) nau=s ga\r . . Id. Ph. 527 ; to/ t' ei)kaqei=n ga\r . . Id. Ant. 1096 ; to\ mh\ qe/mis ga\r . . A. Ch. 641 , cf. 753 : also in Prose, to\ kat' a)ci/an ga\r . . Arist. EN 1163b11 : sts. for metrical reasons, where there is no such connexion, as third ( A. Ag. 222.729 , S. Ph. 219 (all lyr.)), fourth ( Ar. Av. 1545 ); in later Com. fifth ( Men. 462.2 ); sixth ( Antiph. 26.22 ); seventh ( Men. Epit. 531 , Pk. 170 , Athenio 1.5 ); once sixth in S. ,

ge, Dor. and Boeot.
ga, enclitic Particle, giving emphasis to the word or words which it follows. with single words,
at least, at any rate, but often only to be rendered by italics in writing, or emphasis in pronunciation: to\ ga\r . . sidh/rou ge kra/tos e)sti/n such is the power of
iron, Od. 9.393 ; ei)/ pou ptwxw=n ge qeoi\ . . ei)si/n if the poor
have any gods to care for them, 17.475 ; ma/lista/ ge
4.366
; o(/ g' e)nqa/de lew/s
at any rate the people here, S. OC 42 , etc.: with negs., ou) du/o ge not
even two, Il. 5.303 , 20.286 ; ou)/koun fqo/ggos ge not
the least sound, E. IA 9 . with Pronouns: with Pron. of 1st
Pers. so closely joined, that the accent is changed, in e)/gwge, e)/moige (also e)/gwga
Lacon. , but e)gw/nga, i)w/nga
Boeot. ): in Hom. freq. with Art. used as Pron., v. o(/ ge : with demonstr. Pronouns, kei=no/s ge, tou=to/ ge, etc.: in Com. coalescing with -i/ final, au(thgi/
Ar. Ach. 784
; toutogi/, tautagi/, etc., Id. V. 781 , Pax 1057 , etc. (but e)ngetauqi/
Th. 646
): after possess. Pronouns, e)mo/n ge qumo/n
Il. 20.425
, etc.: freq. after relat. Pronouns, o(/s ge, oi(/ ge, etc., oi(/ ge/ sou kaqu/brisan

, etc.; o(/son ge xrh/|zeis

. after Conjunctions, to emphasize the modification or condition introduced by the subjoined clause, pri/n ge, before

really, Th. 6.18 , Pl. Phdr. 25 <*>c; also simply to lay stress on the condition, ka)/n ge mh\ le/gw and

:—for its use in opposed or disjunctive clauses, v. infr. 11.3 . after other Particles, kai\ mh\n . . ge, ou) mh\n . . ge, with words intervening, X. Mem. 1.4.12 , E. Alc. 518 , etc.; after a)/n in apodosi, when preceded by ou) or kai/, Id. Ph. 1215 , Or. 784 ; a)/tar . . ge but
yet, Ar. Ach. 448 ; kai/toi ge, v. kai/ toi; a)lla/ ge (without intervening words) is f.l. in

, cf. A. Th. 1031 , etc.

well (ou)=n), I know Athens (ge), S. OC 24 :—freq. separated by a word, pa/nu g' a)\n ou)=n
Ar. Ec. 806
, cf. Th. 1.76 , etc.:— rarely ge ou)=n in full, D.H. 2.56 codd. (The negat. form is ou)/koun . . ge.)
